availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: At a regular Meeting of the City Council, present Mayor Hall and Councilmen Ladd, Matthews, Talbott & Adams;
The Mayor appointed Councilmen Adams, Talbott and the Clerk a Committee to examine the Poll Book's of yesterday's Election, whereupon the Committee reported the following persons elected to wit;

E. G. Hall, Mayor,
Andr. Clark, Treasurer,
W. W. Catlin, Marshal
P.A. Blackwell, Judge
W. F. Quinn Assessor

P. B. Matthews
F. B. Cromwell
W. H. Sandefur } Councilmen for the 1st Ward

R. G. Beverley
W. H. Ladd
Jos. Adams } Councilman for the 2d Ward
On motion -- the Report is received, Committee discharged and the Mayor is requested to notify the persons mentioned of their Election.
A true Copy of the Records of the Council of the City of Henderson Ky. --

figure.ab:
SEAL OF THE CITY OF HENDERSON.
HENDERSON
COUNTY
KY.

body.p: In pursuance of the foregoing Order of the Mayor and Council of the City of Henderson,
I hereby notify Paul A. Blackwell that he has been duly and legally elected Judge of the City of Henderson for the term of Two years from the 5th day of May 1862.

figure.ab:
SEAL OF THE CITY OF HENDERSON
HENDERSON
COUNTY
KY.

body.p:
E. G. Hall
Mayor
J. A. Blackwell
City Judge
